results.title: Broad jump
results.creator_credit: Edmund Dorfmann, Amateur Athletic Union and United States Olympic Association
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “United World Track and Field”
Shows the development of the technique of broad jump, aka long jump, through to its correct conception and exercise. The balanced development of mobility and well performed athlete.

results.title: British scrapbook. Parts 1 and 2
results.creator_credit: Directorate of Army Kinematography (The War Office)
results.brief_description: A scrapbook look at World War II using some captured enemy film, but mostly film shot by the military cameramen of the forces of the United Nations. Part one: June 1940-October 1942; Part two: November 1942-December 1944.

results.title: Britain welcomes the President of India
results.brief_description: The visit to Britain by the President of India Dr Radhakrishnan. In London he accompanied the Queen on a State drive, visited the Commonwealth Institute, attended a Guildhall luncheon and visited the country.

results.title: Britain down under
results.creator_credit: Una Daniel and Frederick Daniel Productions
results.brief_description: A tour of Tasmania showing various places of interest: life in the two main cities, Hobart and Launceston; the fishing and lobster industries; the raising of sheep and cattle on the rich pasture lands; hop growing; timber from the forests of the islands; tin mining, and the extensive hydro-electric schemes. The various tourist attractions of Tasmania are illustrated with views of coastal scenery and the rugged mountainous country. Also shown are the ruins of the historic penal colony at Port Arthur. Narrated by Jack Davey.

results.title: Bright future...for some
results.brief_description: Third in a series of nine animated films on the history of Western Civilization. Examines the merchants’ reactions when they had to pay road, bridge, market and money exchange tolls to local landlords after riches began pouring in from Europe. Shows how they plotted with the king to stop this “exploitation” and were subsequently successful in having new laws passed in their favour, to the detriment of the peasants and craftsmen. Suitable for lower secondary level.

results.title: Briefing for health
results.brief_description: Indicates the dangers facing the female recruit when she joins the W.A.A.F. The ravages of venereal diseases are illustrated, with information on the avoidance of the disease and on measures to be taken if it is suspected that the disease has been contacted. No other credits available.

results.title: Bridging the learning gap
results.creator_credit: George Pashuk and University of New South Wales. Tertiary Education Research Centre
results.brief_description: Discusses the use of small discussion groups as the main teaching medium in the University’s Faculty of Law, and reasons for the adoption of the system. The role of the teacher in this teaching situation, and the extent to which objectives are being achieved are being evaluated by the T.E.R.C. Increasing student interest and involvement is apparent.

results.title: Bridging the highways
results.creator_credit: John Byrd and Dorman Long & Co
results.brief_description: Steel bridges put together on site from prefabricated universal sections mean a saving in labour and greater speed in bridge constructions. The sections are despatched ready for erection to numerous sites all over modern motorway Britain.

results.title: Bridging the gap
results.brief_description: Designed to help acquire and realise the vital skills of parent-child communications. Dr Thomas Gordon, a nationally recognised authority, discusses such needs as identity, honest recognition of feelings, and courageous action as new methods of communicating, in an attempt to establish a deeper, and more intimate, relationship between parent and child.

results.title: Bride and groom
results.brief_description: An experiment in animation technique produced by a group of amateur film makers, about a newly wed couple who cannot get rid of a door-to-door salesman. Pixillated technique is used in which the principles of animation are applied to real people rather than inanimate materials such as drawings and three-dimensional puppets.
